intro: Fimbristylis doliiformis, commonly known as the globe sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant typically found in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a three-angled, globose capsule that contains three seeds. Fimbristylis doliiformis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in wetland environments.
